section_title: 21d04 - Example of application of Sec 13(a)(4) requirements.
text:
(a)   As an example of how the percentage requirements for
exemption under Sec 13(a)(4) might be applied, the following illustration is
offered. The ABC Bakery Shop, located at Portchester, New York, near the New
York-Connecticut boundary, does all of the baking of breads and pastries and
the selling of these bread and pastries at the same establishment, and in
addition purchases milk and cream for resale to its customers. It sells and
delivers not only to private individuals for home consumption, but also to
certain restaurants and roadside diners located in New York and nearby
Connecticut. (b)  An analysis of its ADV of sales discloses:

 (c)   The establishment meets the qualification that 50% or
more of its ADV of sales must be made within the State in which it is located -
$76,000 out of a total of $100,000. (d)  The establishment meets the qualification that 75% or
more of its sales are recognized as retail in the industry and not for resale -
$86,000 out of $100,000. (e)   The establishment does not meet the qualification that
85% of its ADV of sales of the goods made by it, namely the breads and
pastries, must be sold within the State—only $70,000 out of $90,000 is sold
within the State. (f)   Because it does not meet the requirement that 85% of
its ADV of sales of the goods made by it must be sold within the State, the ABC
Bakery Shop cannot be exempted under Sec 13(a)(4), and the employees making the
breads and pastries are not exempt. However, since the establishment meets the
requirements for exemption under Sec 13(a)(2), all other employees employed by
it are exempt, except those who engaged in producing breads and pastries
